lg.l: illegible lineillegible Stella to his illegible invite
He entertaind her half a year
With richest Wines and costly Cheer
Surpris'd with every day a hott meal
She thought that all the World was Oatmeal
Don Carlos made her chief Director
She now can o're the Servants hector
In half a Week the Dame grew Nice
Got all things at the highest price
Now at the Table Head she sitts
Presented with the choicest bitts
She lookt on Partridges with scorn
Except they taisted of the Corn
A haunch of Venison made her sweat
Unless it had the right Fumett
Don Carlos earnestly would beg
Dear Madam try this Pidgeons leg
Was happy when he could prevayl
To make her only touch a Quayl
Through Candle-light she view'd the wine
To see that every Glass was fineAt last grown prouder than the Divil
With feeding high, and Treatment Civil
Too soon arrives the Dismall Day
She must return to Ormond-Key
Don Carlos now began to find
His med'cine work as he designed
As the coach stopt she look't and swore
The Rascall had mistook the Dore
At going in you saw her stoop
The Narrow Entry brusht her Hoop
She curst the dark and winding stairs
And still encreasing in her Airs
Began a thousand faults to spy
The Cillegibleling hardly six foot hiillegibleh
The smoaky Wainscote fillegible of illegible
And half the Chairs witillegible backs
The Cupbord fastned illegibleh a Peg
The rusty Tongs illegible lost a leg
Her quarters out aillegibleady Day
She'll have em killegiblew she scorns to stay
(While there are illegibleses to be lett)
In lodgings like illegible poor Grisette
Mean time tholeillegibleeep her spirits up
She sends for company to sup;illegible all the while, you might remark
She strove in vain to Ape Woodpark
Two bottles calld for (half her Store)
The Cellar couldwould contain but four)
A supper worthy of her self,
Five Nothings in five plates of Delf,
thus for a week the farce went on
When the whole Moneths allowance gone
She fell into the former scene
Small beer a hering and the Dean.Since J must laugh, or cannot live,
Good Natured Stella will forgive,
Wee Poets when a Hint is new
Regard not what is false or true,
No Raillery gives just offence
Where truth hashad not the least pretence
Nor can be more securly plac't
Than or a Nimph of Stella's taist
J must confess your wine and Vittle
J was to hard upon──a little
And you must know in what J writt
J hadhas some anger in my witt
For when you sigh to leave Woodpark
The Place, the wellcom, and the spark,
To languish in this odious Town
And pull your haughty stomach down,
You shew Don Carlos where to dwell,
And grieve he ever left Pell-mell.
Yet granting all J sayd were true,
A Cottage is Woodpark with you745-458J
